# UIWritingToolsCoordinator.ContextScope

**Enumeration**

Options that indicate how much of your content Writing Tools requested.

## Declaration

```swift
enum ContextScope
```

## Overview

At the start of any Writing Tools interaction, you provide the text for the system to evaluate from your [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWritingToolsCoordinator/Delegate-swift.protocol] object. The request for your content comes with a scope constant that indicates how much of your view’s text to provide.

## Getting the scope

- **UIWritingToolsCoordinator.ContextScope.userSelection**: An option to provide only the view’s currently selected text.
- **UIWritingToolsCoordinator.ContextScope.fullDocument**: An option to provide all of your view’s text.
- **UIWritingToolsCoordinator.ContextScope.visibleArea**: An option to provide only the text in the currently visible portion of your view.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Getting the supporting types

- **UIWritingToolsCoordinator.TextReplacementReason**: Options that indicate whether Writing Tools is animating changes to your view’s text.
- **UIWritingToolsCoordinator.TextAnimation**: The types of animations that Writing Tools performs during an interactive update of your view.

- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
